meaningMnemonic:
This is a single kanji with an い on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>pain</kanji>? It's <vocabulary>painful</vocabulary>. 

痛い is commonly used to say that some part of the body hurts or feels sore.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: An <reading>eate</reading>r (いた) is someone who eats. But, the eater hurt his mouth. So now it's <vocabulary>painful</vocabulary> to eat.
